alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 04 at 8:00PM AKDT until July 06 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNINGS IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 220, 221, 222, 223, 224, 225 AND 226... A broad area of thunderstorm activity is expected again Tuesday with extremely dry fuels across the area. Thunderstorm activity is expected during the afternoons and evenings through the remainder of the week. Relative Humidity values will fall into the 25 to 35 percent range. Overnight recovery will be fair to poor. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT TUESDAY NIGHT FOR LIGHTNING FOR EASTERN ALASKA RANGE... * AFFECTED AREA...Eastern Alaska Range. * TIMING...Until Midnight Tuesday night. * LIGHTNING ACTIVITY LEVEL...4. * WINDS...Northeast 5 to 10 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 30 percent. * TEMPERATURES...70 to 77. * IMPACTS...Ample lightning could lead to numerous new fire starts.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
